blog_title: console.log(3<10>1) ?
blog_content: The expression 3<10>1 evaluates to false because the comparison operators are evaluated from left to right, and 3<10 is true, but true>1 is false. Explanation The expression 3<10>1 uses two comparison operators, < and >, to compare three numbers: 3, 10, and 1. The comparison operators have left-to-right associativity, which means that they are evaluated from left to right. So, the expression is evaluated as (3<10)>1.
